job description:
Basic Qualifications
  • Masters degree (quantitative field such as Computer Science, Statistics, or Mathematics preferred)
  • Minimum of 4 years statistical modeling
  • Minimum of 2 years of experience with the statistical language of R
Preferred Qualifications
  • Coding experience with R/ SAS/ open source programing platforms
  • Experience handling data driven decisions in technology / online marketing channels/ email campaigns / internet domain
  • Ability to communicate concisely and persuasively with engineers and product managers
  • Experience in various statistical and machine learning models, data mining, unstructured data analytics in corporate or academic research environments
  • Experience with at least one of the following - Reliability models, Markov Models, Stochastic models, Bayesian Modelling, Classification Models, Cluster Analysis, Neural Network, Non-parametric Methods, Multivariate Statistics
  • Passion to answer Product/Engineering questions with data
  • Ability to think creatively to solve real world business problems
  • Familiarity with relational databases and intermediate level knowledge of SQL
  • Ability to work in a global collaborative team environment
  • Proficient verbal and written communication skills in English
Professional Skill Requirements
Proven success in contributing to a team-oriented environment
Proven ability to work creatively and analytically in a problem-solving environment
Desire to work in an information systems environment
Excellent leadership, communication (written and oral) and interpersonal skills

Applicants for employment in the US must have work authorization that does not now or in the future require sponsorship of a visa for employment authorization in the United States and with Accenture.
